input:
Arsenal 3 - 3 Anderlecht

15:58 Event: Shots on target by Anderlecht
16:10 Caption: Sacha Kljestan (Anderlecht) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Wojciech Szczesny thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
16:27 Event: Ball out of play
16:36 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
17:54 Caption: Great teamplay by Arsenal as they control the ball with a lot of short passes. Patience is the key if they want to find a gap in the defence to score.

20:21 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
20:46 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
20:47 Event: Ball out of play
21:00 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!

21:25 Event: Ball out of play
21:34 Event: Throw-in by Anderlecht
21:43 Event: Ball out of play
21:46 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
22:38 Caption: Calum Chambers (Arsenal) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence clears the ball to safety.
23:17 Caption: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
23:30 Event: Foul by Anderlecht
23:41 Caption: Clement Turpin couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Chancel Mbemba (Anderlecht) and blew his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Arsenal!
24:03 Caption: Mikel Arteta (Arsenal) sends Silvio Proto the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

25:51 Caption: Anderlecht seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.
26:05 Event: Ball out of play
26:07 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
27:01 Event: Foul by Anderlecht
27:17 Caption: Clement Turpin blows his whistle and signals a foul after Anthony Vanden Borre (Anderlecht) brought his opponent down. Arsenal win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
27:59 Event: Direct free-kick by Arsenal
27:59 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
28:01 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
28:02 Event: Goal by Arsenal
28:20 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but the goalkeeper perfectly sets up the defensive wall and his effort is thwarted.
28:27 Caption: Goal! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Silvio Proto is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:0.
28:49 Event: Kick-off by Anderlecht
29:14 Event: Foul by Arsenal
29:41 Caption: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) brings an opponent down and Clément Turpin interrupts the game. A free kick to Anderlecht.
30:05 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
30:24 Caption: Youri Tielemans (Anderlecht) takes the free kick but it is cleared by the first defender.
30:34 Event: Ball out of play
30:46 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
31:27 Event: Ball out of play
31:38 Caption: Arsenal display good ball movement. They are waiting for some opportunity to get in a chance, but now the attack is averted. It will be a corner kick for Arsenal.
31:56 Event: Corner by Arsenal
31:58 Event: Ball out of play
32:02 Caption: Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) takes the corner which is cleared. The referee signals a corner kick to Arsenal.
32:16 Event: Corner by Arsenal
32:27 Caption: The ball is whipped in from the corner by Santi Cazorla (Arsenal), but one of the defenders gets it clear.
32:37 Event: Ball out of play
32:44 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
33:03 Event: Shots on target by Anderlecht
33:04 Event: Ball out of play
33:23 Caption: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the box but his shot is blocked. Anderlecht have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
33:26 Event: Corner by Anderlecht
33:31 Event: Ball out of play
33:49 Caption: The corner from Youri Tielemans (Anderlecht) is intercepted by the defence. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Anderlecht.
33:51 Event: Corner by Anderlecht
34:15 Caption: A dangerous looking corner kick from Youri Tielemans (Anderlecht) is cleared to safety by the defence.
35:44 Caption: Long passes, short passes and one-two passes. Arsenal are showcasing great team work by keeping possession and producing pin-point passes from player to player. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult to intercept at the moment.
36:50 Caption: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) sends over a cross, but he can't find any teammate inside the box. Poor delivery.
38:10 Event: Shots off target by Arsenal
38:11 Event: Ball out of play
38:30 Event: Clearance by Anderlecht
38:30 Caption: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) makes a yard for himself and goes for goal from long range. It never troubles the goalkeeper as it flies well wide of the right post.
38:52 Event: Ball out of play
39:09 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
40:19 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
40:20 Event: Ball out of play
40:20 Caption: A pass from Cyriac Gohi Bi (Anderlecht) is intercepted by Wojciech Szczesny and the move breaks down.
40:55 Caption: CHANCE! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot to the bottom left corner, but Silvio Proto produces an excellent save. Arsenal have a corner.
40:56 Event: Corner by Arsenal
41:03 Event: Ball out of play
41:04 Caption: The resulting corner from Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) comes to nothing.
41:18 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
42:01 Event: Ball out of play
42:20 Caption: Arsenal's players are in a nice combination. They show their ability to keep the ball possession, sending it precisely from one to another. But now the final pass is intercepted. Arsenal earn a corner.
42:27 Event: Corner by Arsenal
42:36 Event: Foul by Arsenal
42:37 Caption: Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) puts a cross into the box from the corner but there is no panic from the opposition and they easily clear.
42:45 Event: Indirect free-kick by Anderlecht
42:56 Event: Foul by Anderlecht
42:57 Caption: Clement Turpin interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Mikel Arteta (Arsenal).
42:59 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
43:44 Event: Foul by Anderlecht
44:07 Caption: Sacha Kljestan (Anderlecht) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Clement Turpin blows his whistle for an infringement. Arsenal will take a free kick near the side line.
44:31 Caption: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) requires medical treatment, so the referee stops play and signals for the physio to come onto the pitch.
45:30 Caption: Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) delivers a poor cross from a free kick as one of the defenders comfortably clears it away.
46:24 Caption: There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Clement Turpin has ended it.
46:59 Caption: The fans must be pleased so far with the entertainment on the pitch. Let's hope the players don't lose their passion and determination during the half-time break. The home side is dominant and dictating the tempo of the game, mainly because of their work rate and accurate passing. The home side display their usual fluent passing, while the visitors use their organization to stop the build up and launch counter-attacks.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Substitution by Anderlecht
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Anderlecht
00:00 Caption: There will be a minimum of 1 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Ibrahima Conte comes off for Andy Kawaya (Anderlecht).
00:01 Caption: Referee Clement Turpin blows his whistle to start the second half.
01:35 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
01:44 Event: Ball out of play

11:47 Caption: Arsenal slow the tempo of the game down by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult at the moment, very physically demanding to run without the ball.

12:35 Event: Goal by Arsenal

44:26 Event: Goal by Anderlecht
44:41 Caption: Goal! Andy Najar clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Aleksandar Mitrovic (Anderlecht), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom right corner. Wojciech Szczesny had no chance of stopping that. 3:2.
45:39 Event: Kick-off by Arsenal
46:15 Event: Foul by Anderlecht

46:22 Event: Shots off target by Arsenal
46:24 Event: Ball out of play

46:54 Event: Ball out of play

47:41 Caption: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Anthony Vanden Borre (Anderlecht) was quite harsh and Clement Turpin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
47:48 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
48:13 Event: Foul by Anderlecht
48:22 Caption: Dennis Praet (Anderlecht) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Clement Turpin with no other option than to blow for a foul. Arsenal earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
49:02 Caption: The resulting set piece, sent into the penalty area by Santi Cazorla (Arsenal), was easily dealt with by one of the defenders.
49:09 Caption: There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
49:59 Caption: The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. The superiority of the away team was evident on the pitch today. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible. The away team was pressing and leaving the opponents little space for combination play.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Arsenal faced Anderlecht in an electrifying match that ended in a dramatic 3-3 draw. From the moment the referee blew the whistle for kick-off, Arsenal took charge, exhibiting control and dominance on the pitch. The game commenced with Arsenal's initial thrust, but the ball was soon out of play.

In the third minute, Anderlecht sought to alleviate the early pressure with a clearance, only for the ball to again find itself out of play twice within minutes, each team battling to gain early dominance. Arsenal managed to catch their breath and slow down the tempo with a throw-in. Shortly after, an infringement by an Arsenal player resulted in an indirect free-kick for Anderlecht, yet nothing substantial materialized from it.

The game ebbed and flowed with several throw-ins and fouls interrupting the flow. The first real goal-scoring opportunity came in the 11th minute when Aaron Ramsey found himself inside the box with a chance to strike. His shot, however, was blocked brilliantly by a defender, leading to a corner for Arsenal. Santi Cazorla swung in the corner, which was subsequently cleared by the defense.

As the minutes ticked by, Arsenal consistently displayed superior team play, characterized by short, incisive passes. A crisp pass sequence led to Alexis Sanchez crashing a powerful shot against the right post in the 21st minute, only for Anderlecht to respond with a clearance. Each team's defensive strategies appeared robust with constant interceptions and clearances.

In the 23rd minute, Arsenal was awarded a penalty following Chancel Mbemba's rough tackle on an opponent. Mikel Arteta capitalized on the opportunity by sending the goalkeeper Silvio Proto the wrong way and coolly slotting the ball into the net, making it 1-0 for Arsenal. Anderlecht sought to compose themselves with subsequent possession but lacked the cutting edge to trouble Arsenal.

Five minutes later, Alexis Sanchez extended the lead for Arsenal. After initially thwarting his free-kick effort, the rebound fell kindly to him, and he made no mistake, sending a low shot into the bottom right corner. The score now stood at 2-0 in favor of the home side. Arsenal continued to press, exhibiting superior ball control and movement through intricate passing sequences.

Amid the relentless pressure, Anderlecht managed to earn a promising free-kick in the 30th minute, but it was effectively cleared by Arsenal's defense. Despite Anderlecht’s best efforts to breach Arsenal's solid defense, the likes of Calum Chambers continuously broke up play by intercepting crosses and clearing the ball to safety.

Arsenal showcased their dominance once again nearing halftime. Opportunities were created with frequent incursions into Anderlecht's box, Danny Welbeck nearly netting a low-driven effort, only to be denied by a brilliant save from Proto. The first half concluded with Arsenal comfortably leading 2-0 and exhibiting a well-oiled passing game.

The second half resumed with Anderlecht making an immediate substitution, bringing on Andy Kawaya in place of Ibrahima Conte. Yet, it was Arsenal who demonstrated early intent. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's swift shot was blocked, leading to a corner which was unfortunately overhit.

Chancel Mbemba’s injury led to his substitution by Leander Dendoncker in the eighth minute. Arsenal continued to press and keep possession, creating another golden opportunity in the 13th minute when Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain made it 3-0 with a fine solo run and accomplished strike into the bottom right corner.

Anderlecht's quick response came in the 15th minute. Anthony Vanden Borre pulled one back for the visitors with a close-range finish after receiving a quality assist from Andy Kawaya, signaling Anderlecht’s intent to fight back. Anderlecht then introduced Aleksandar Mitrovic, who almost immediately became influential in unsettling Arsenal’s defense.

Arteta’s forced substitution due to injury saw Mathieu Flamini come on for Arsenal. Anderlecht's probing resulted in several corners, yet Arsenal’s defense remained resolute. However, in the 27th minute, Nacho Monreal's foul resulted in a penalty for Anderlecht, and Vanden Borre made no mistake from the spot, reducing the deficit to 3-2.

Arsenal deployed Tomas Rosicky and Lukas Podolski to strengthen their ranks, replacing Oxlade-Chamberlain and Welbeck. Despite these changes, Anderlecht's pressing continued to create shooting opportunities, one of which saw Frank Acheampong narrowly miss the target with a shot flying just over the bar.

Both sides demonstrated fierce determination as the game edged towards full-time. Arsenal encountered several interruptions due to fouls and free-kicks but kept creating scoring opportunities. Santi Cazorla's set-pieces put Anderlecht under pressure, though their defense managed to intercept effectively.

The drama heightened in the 44th minute as Anderlecht found an equalizer with Aleksandar Mitrovic scoring a remarkable header from Andy Najar’s precise cross, leaving Wojciech Szczesny with no chance. The score was leveled at 3-3.

As the final whistles beckoned, Arsenal pushed to reclaim their lead, with Lukas Podolski firing a late effort wide off the target. Anderlecht’s defensive coherence coupled with Arsenal’s persistence characterized the match's closing minutes. Anderlecht's Anthony Vanden Borre received a booking late in the game for a harsh tackle.

The match ended in a captivating 3-3 draw. Both teams exhibited commendable resolve and skill, providing a spectacle of high-energy football. Arsenal, despite their initial dominance and a 3-0 lead, found themselves under considerable pressure as Anderlecht clawed their way back into the match. This game exemplified the thrilling unpredictability of football, leaving both sets of fans in awe of the pulsating encounter they witnessed. 

The draw was a testament to Anderlecht’s resilience and tactical adaptability, particularly in the second half, while Arsenal showed their capacity to dominate throughout significant portions of the match. The players' commitment and tactical nuances on both teams were praised, encapsulating a display of dramatic, entertaining football.
